timeline.bodyText: I actually did this intentionally; assuming that the client and the server bits have the same codecs. The reason is, to load the new server/client version with an old data log (i.e. uncompressed), and the data can be compressed by bouncing the servers one-by-one to trigger state transfer and compress the data without having to rewrite it via checkpoint. Maybe that's not a deal breaker, but its just something for you to consider.
